Sentencas: Heat and mass transfer effects in evaporating solution droplets (20-40 mu m in diameter) containing dissolved hexahydrated cerium nitrate in a stationary rf Ar-O-2 thermal plasma were investigated using a model.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: The evaporation occurred under reduced pressure.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: The impact of different plasma operating parameters on temperature and dissolved solid content profiles was studied: surrounding plasma temperature, initial salt content and droplet size, plasma gas composition, and system pressure.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: Temperature and composition dependant thermophysical properties were used.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: The model was solved in a moving frame (ALE method) and considered Stefan flow.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: The results indicate that a salt supersaturation limit is reached at the droplet surface which leads to salt precipitation and formation of a crust in all cases analyzed.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: This is favored by higher plasma temperatures, lower pressures, oxygen-rich plasma and higher salt content.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure

Sentencas: Smaller droplets developed a crust faster than larger droplets.
Titulo: Transient heat, mass and momentum transfer of an evaporating stationary droplet containing dissolved cerium nitrate in a rf thermal argon-oxygen plasma under reduced pressure
